meanings.def: to close something; to become closed
examples: The window won't shut.
The doors open and shut automatically.
The door shuts and locks behind her.
shut something Philip went into his room and shut the door behind him.
I can't shut my suitcase—it's too full.
She shut her eyes and fell asleep immediately.
He shut his book and looked up.

meanings.def: when a shop, restaurant, etc. shuts or when somebody shuts it, it stops being open for business and you cannot go into it
examples: The bank shuts at 4.
What time do the shops shut on Saturday?
We left the hotel only to discover that the whole city shuts at 10.30.
The factory is going to shut next year.
shut something We decided to shut the cafe early as there were no customers.
They're going to shut two plants in Texas and fire 2 240 workers.
What time do the banks close/​shut?
A strike has shut the factory.
The store is closed/​shut today.
a closed window.
The road is closed because of the snow.

meanings.def: to make it unlikely that something will happen
examples: She was careful not to close the door on the possibility of further talks.

meanings.def: to not talk about something to somebody because it is a secret or because it will upset or annoy them
examples: I've warned them to keep their mouths shut about this.
Now she's upset—why couldn't you keep your mouth shut?
The athletes were warned to keep their mouths shut about politics.

meanings.def: to shut a door hard when somebody is trying to come in
to refuse to talk to somebody or meet them, in a rude way
to make it unlikely that something will happen
examples: She was careful not to shut the door on the possibility of further talks.

meanings.def: to refuse to listen to something
examples: She decided to shut her ears to all the rumours.

meanings.def: to pretend that you have not noticed something so that you do not have to deal with it
examples: You can't just close your eyes to his violence.
They seem intent on shutting their eyes to the problems of pollution.

meanings.def: a rude way of telling somebody to be quiet or stop talking
to close a business permanently or to stop working for the day
very easily, without thinking about it
examples: I've made this trip so often, I could do it with my eyes shut.
